name: The Analog Club
description:
Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.

Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling.

Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!

Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).

We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.

Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age!


Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.

location.name: The studio by copper and cloves
location.address: The studio by copper and cloves, Bangalore

name: Supper Clubs of India: Sweet Talk with Sakaré
description:
Bengaluru Servd and NIC Ice Creams present: Supper Clubs of India - Bengaluru Edition, a series of intimate dining experiences highlighting regional community-style meals and cuisines from across India!

Chef Jenny Clinta, founder of one of Bengaluru’s favourite Supper Clubs, Sakaré, is bringing us a pastry-lover’s feast!

Started in 2024, Sakaré was a way to showcase Chef Jenny’s journey from the Andamans to France where she trained to become a professional pastry chef.
For our Supper Club, she’s bringing back her iconic Gajar dessert, her personal favourite- the Tiramisu, her famous Macarons, Apple Tarte Tatin, and many more dishes.

DISCLAIMER: All dishes contain Egg.

The 7-course tasting menu starts with savouries followed by a palate cleanser as well as two indulgent dishes paired with surprise NIC Ice Creams flavours and petit fours to end the experience.
The entire supper is crafted to be perfectly-balanced in its sweetness with ingredients from the Andamans as well such as locally-sourced Pandan and Cinnamon!

Also enjoy curated cocktails as you dive into the meal.

NOTE: Once tickets are booked, please share your meal preference (Eggetarian or Non-Vegetarian) along with any allergies with us on WhatsApp at 8123265307

Join us on Saturday, 11th October at Daysie, MG Road.
Limited seats. Book yours now!

Menu:
Jam and Crust 
Focaccia, Tomato Jam, Garlic Confit Herbed Butter

Course 1
Island Stack 
Blinis, Chammanthi, Spiced Mushroom/Chicken, Chimichurri, Dessicated Coconut

Course 2
Mom’s Special Banana/Fish Cutlet 
Fish Cutlet/Raw Banana Pate, Pain Demi, Banana Flower Salad

Course 3
Apple Tatin
Apple Tarte Tatin, Poached Apples, Creme Diplomat, Rosemary, Crumble, Cinnamon Wafer Garnish with a surprise NIC Ice Creams flavour

Course 4
Gajjar 
Confit Gajar, Rabri Mousse, Pistachio Sable

Course 5
Petals and Palm
Coconut Sprout, Candied Rose Petals, Coconut Veil, Tender Coconut Granita, Pickled Cucumber 

Course 6
Something Like Tiramisu 
Mascarpone Mousse, Coffee Sponge, Cocoa Crumble, Coffee Tuille, Coffee Caviar with a surprise NIC Ice Creams flavour

Course 7
Petit Four
Khara, Lemon Madeleine, Blueberry Cheese Macaron

name: Greater Than Bars From Far
description:
A cocktail festival that brings 9 of the best bars and bartenders from India, under one roof. Bars From Far by Greater Than Gin is back in Bangalore for its second edition.

What can you expect? Great cocktails, food pop-ups, and a fantastic music lineup featuring electronic, disco, afro, and house genres.

Experience a selection of the best bars from Goa, Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Jaipur and Chandigarh, alongside Nao Spirits’ very own MTW Bar and Toasties.

BFF is where you'll find the best bartenders stirring up the best cocktails by some of the best bars from across the country, but without leaving your city.

It's a bar crawl, but without the crawl. So mark your calendars and bring your BFF along to our BFF!

description:

name: Family Day
description:
They say it takes a village to raise a child. This October, we’re calling that village made up of all the parents, maamas and atthes, daadas and daadis, mom’s best friend and dad’s anna to come over to MAP and celebrate. Bring your children, nieces and nephews, grandkids and godchildren for a fun-filled day of exploration, games, and stories!

From exciting quizzes and treasure hunts, to playful walkthroughs of our exhibitions, the day is packed with activities designed especially for children. Pause at special stations to listen, play, and discover together. Wrap up the experience with a delightful theatre performance for young audiences. We’ve got the whole day sorted—all you need is a child (or a few!) to join in. The more, the merrier!

name: Femtech India x Coro: Diwali Gathering
description:
Lighting the Way: Women Redefining Wellness & Work

Come celebrate the spirit of Diwali with light, conversations, and community. An intimate evening where women leaders, entrepreneurs, and changemakers come together to share stories, spark connections, and illuminate new paths forward.

✨ What to expect:
– Warm welcome ritual
– Panel: “Lighting the Way: Women Building the Future”
– Conversations on wellness, technology & inclusive workspaces
– High tea with a festive Indian twist and festive surprises

Dress code : Festive & Elegant Indian Wear

name: DIY Camera Obscura
description:
Build & Experiment with a Handmade Pinhole Camera
Long before lenses and megapixels, there was the camera obscura—a simple box, a pinhole, and the magic of light painting an image. In this workshop with artist Stuti Bansal, you’ll make your own camera obscura from scratch, explore the principles of analogue image-making, and develop unique photographs using light-sensitive paper.
You’ll get to:
* Build your own working camera obscura
* Learn the science & history behind the camera obscura
* Experiment with capturing and developing images
* Take home your handmade camera + prints you create
Who is it for?  Artists, photographers, makers, students, and anyone curious about analog photography and light-based art. No prior experience required.

About the Facilitator
Stuti Bansal (she/her), is artist/filmmaker based in Bangalore. Her interest is in diy methods and in curating alternative spaces for film screening/gathering - working with animation, installation, analogue film material. She has done her MA from Royal College of Art, London and has a Diploma from Friedl Kubelka Schule for Indepent Film, Vienna. Recently she was part of Khoj Peers Artist Residency in Delhi. Her works have been exhibited in many independent spaces internationally.

General Rules:
-Ages 14 and above.
-Contact 9845620061 for more details.

name: Origami Flashers Workshop
description:
Join us for a hands-on introduction to the art of origami. An origami flasher is a folding pattern, often from a square sheet of paper, that can transform between a compressed state and an expanded, often 3D, form.
In this beginner-friendly workshop, we’ll explore basic folding techniques and learn how to create flashers. These models are known for their dynamic, self-folding, or rotating properties, which allow them to "flash" or change shape with a simple action. The design concept has been applied in the engineering field for deployable structures like solar arrays, as the paper can be compacted for transport and then expanded in space. 
All materials will be provided. Feel free to bring your own patterned/ colored papers/ used gift wrapping papers / paper bags for the workshop

General Rules:
-Ages 14 and above.
-Contact 9845620061 for more details.

name: SIS x Tenzee Wall Climbing
description:
Our Top Rope Climbing is designed for beginners looking to explore the exciting world of climbing in a safe and supportive environment. Participants will learn the fundamental of Top Rope Climbing, including essential techniques, safety protocols and equipment usage.

Introductory Training : Basic climbing techniques, body positioning, and climbing movement.
Safety Briefing : Essential safety protocols, including how to properly use harnesses, belay devices, and ropes.
Equipment Overview : Hands-on experience with climbing gear, such as harnesses, ropes, carabiners, and climbing shoes.
Belaying Skills: Learn how to safely belay a partner, ensuring a secure climbing experience.
Problem Solving : Techniques for overcoming challenges and improving your climbing strategy
Community Atmosphere : Opportunities to connect with fellow beginners and share experiences in a supportive environment.

name: SIS x Swysh Pickleball Gameday
description:
Pickle, Play & Pay at Swysh!
Ready for some smashing fun? Join us at Swysh Pickleball for 90 minutes of non-stop rallies, laughter, and friendly competition. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned player, this is your chance to hit the court, break a sweat, and enjoy the fastest-growing sport with your crew.

Grab your friends, bring your game face, and let’s make it a pickle party!
Limited slots – sign up now!

name: SIS x C+C: Warrior Rhythm
description:
WARRIOR strength is a high-energy mix of cardio and strength training set to killer playlists and fun, functional formats. expect to sweat, burn, and feel amazing — all while boosting heart health.
